response_parsed.title: Leveraging lzma and Typing in Production-Grade Python 3.12+ Code
response_parsed.summary: This explainer details the practical application of the _lzma and typing modules in Python 3.12+ to optimize and type-check your production code, enhancing efficiency and reducing errors.
key_points: Understanding and utilizing the _lzma module for compressing and decompressing data efficiently
Implementing type hints and annotations with the typing module to improve code readability and safety
Best practices when combining lzma compression and typed objects in production-grade Python 3.12+ applications

code_examples.code:
from io import BytesIO
from _lzma import compress, MAX_COMPRESS_LEVEL
from typing import BinaryIO

def compress_file(file: BinaryIO) -> bytes:
    compressed = BytesIO()
    compress(compress.FORMAT_LZMA, MAX_COMPRESS_LEVEL, file.read(), 0, compressed)
    return compressed.getvalue()
